verses.kjv: In those days the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples unto him, and saith unto them,
verses.web: In those days, when there was a very great multitude, and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to himself, and said to them,
verses.ct: Around that time, another massive crowd had gathered, and they had nothing to eat. Jesus called his disciples over and said to them,

verses.kjv: I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat:
verses.web: “I have compassion on the multitude, because they have stayed with me now three days, and have nothing to eat.
verses.ct: "My heart goes out to these people. They've been with me for 3 days now and have nothing to eat.

verses.kjv: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for divers of them came from far.
verses.web: If I send them away fasting to their home, they will faint on the way, for some of them have come a long way.”
verses.ct: If I send them home hungry, they'll collapse on the way — some of them have traveled a long distance."

verses.kjv: And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness?
verses.web: His disciples answered him, “From where could one satisfy these people with bread here in a deserted place?”
verses.ct: His disciples replied, "Where could anyone find enough bread to feed all these people out here in the middle of nowhere?"

verses.kjv: And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven.
verses.web: He asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” They said, “Seven.”
verses.ct: Jesus asked them, "How many loaves do you have?" They answered, "7."

verses.kjv: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before them; and they did set them before the people.
verses.web: He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground, and he took the seven loaves. Having given thanks, he broke them, and gave them to his disciples to serve, and they served the multitude.
verses.ct: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground. Then he took the 7 loaves, gave thanks to God, broke them apart, and handed the pieces to his disciples to pass out. They served the food to the crowd.

verses.kjv: And they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also before them.
verses.web: They had a few small fish. Having blessed them, he said to serve these also.
verses.ct: They also had a few small fish. Jesus blessed them and told the disciples to serve those as well.

verses.kjv: So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets.
verses.web: They ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets of broken pieces that were left over.
verses.ct: Everyone ate until they were full, and when they collected the leftovers, they filled 7 baskets.

verses.kjv: And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.
verses.web: Those who had eaten were about four thousand. Then he sent them away.
verses.ct: About 4,000 people had eaten. After that, Jesus sent the crowd on their way.

verses.kjv: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.
verses.web: Immediately he entered into the boat with his disciples, and came into the region of Dalmanutha.
verses.ct: Right away, he got into a boat with his disciples and headed to the region of Dalmanutha.

verses.kjv: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.
verses.web: The Pharisees came out and began to question him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, and testing him.
verses.ct: The Pharisees showed up and started arguing with him, demanding a miraculous sign from heaven to test him.

verses.kjv: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.
verses.web: He sighed deeply in his spirit, and said, “Why does this generation seek a sign? Most certainly I tell you, no sign will be given to this generation.”
verses.ct: Jesus let out a deep sigh and said, "Why does this generation keep demanding a sign? I'm telling you the truth — no sign will be given to this generation."

verses.kjv: And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.
verses.web: He left them, and again entering into the boat, departed to the other side.
verses.ct: Then he left them, got back in the boat, and crossed to the other side of the lake.

verses.kjv: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.
verses.web: They forgot to take bread; and they didn’t have more than one loaf in the boat with them.
verses.ct: The disciples had forgotten to bring food along, and they only had one loaf of bread with them in the boat.

verses.kjv: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and of the leaven of Herod.
verses.web: He warned them, saying, “Take heed: beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”
verses.ct: Jesus warned them, "Watch out — guard yourselves against the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod."

verses.kjv: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, It is because we have no bread.
verses.web: They reasoned with one another, saying, “It’s because we have no bread.”
verses.ct: They started discussing this among themselves, saying, "He's saying this because we didn't bring any bread."

verses.kjv: And when Jesus knew it, he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?
verses.web: Jesus, perceiving it, said to them, “Why do you reason that it’s because you have no bread? Don’t you perceive yet, neither understand? Is your heart still hardened?
verses.ct: Jesus knew what they were thinking and said, "Why are you talking about having no bread? Do you still not get it? Do you still not understand? Are your hearts that hard?

verses.kjv: Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?
verses.web: Having eyes, don’t you see? Having ears, don’t you hear? Don’t you remember?
verses.ct: You have eyes — can't you see? You have ears — can't you hear? Don't you remember?

verses.kjv: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? They say unto him, Twelve.
verses.web: When I broke the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?” They told him, “Twelve.”
verses.ct: When I broke the 5 loaves for the 5,000, how many baskets of leftovers did you pick up?" They answered, "12."

verses.kjv: And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? And they said, Seven.
verses.web: “When the seven loaves fed the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?” They told him, “Seven.”
verses.ct: "And when I broke the 7 loaves for the 4,000, how many baskets of leftovers did you pick up?" They said, "7."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?
verses.web: He asked them, “Don’t you understand yet?”
verses.ct: He said to them, "How is it that you still don't understand?"

verses.kjv: And he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.
verses.web: He came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to him, and begged him to touch him.
verses.ct: They arrived at Bethsaida, and some people brought a blind man to Jesus, begging him to touch the man and heal him.

verses.kjv: And he took the blind man by the hand, and led him out of the town; and when he had spit on his eyes, and put his hands upon him, he asked him if he saw ought.
verses.web: He took hold of the blind man by the hand, and brought him out of the village. When he had spat on his eyes, and laid his hands on him, he asked him if he saw anything.
verses.ct: Jesus took the blind man by the hand and led him outside the village. He spit on the man's eyes, placed his hands on him, and asked, "Can you see anything?"

verses.kjv: And he looked up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.
verses.web: He looked up, and said, “I see men; for I see them like trees walking.”
verses.ct: The man looked up and said, "I can see people, but they look like trees walking around."

verses.kjv: After that he put his hands again upon his eyes, and made him look up: and he was restored, and saw every man clearly.
verses.web: Then again he laid his hands on his eyes. He looked intently, and was restored, and saw everyone clearly.
verses.ct: Jesus placed his hands on the man's eyes again. This time the man looked hard, and his sight was completely restored — he could see everything clearly.

verses.kjv: And he sent him away to his house, saying, Neither go into the town, nor tell it to any in the town.
verses.web: He sent him away to his house, saying, “Don’t enter into the village, nor tell anyone in the village.”
verses.ct: Jesus sent him home with instructions: "Don't go into the village, and don't tell anyone there about this."

verses.kjv: And Jesus went out, and his disciples, into the towns of Caesarea Philippi: and by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Whom do men say that I am?
verses.web: Jesus went out, with his disciples, into the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples, “Who do men say that I am?”
verses.ct: Jesus and his disciples traveled to the villages around Caesarea Philippi. Along the way, he asked them, "Who do people say I am?"

verses.kjv: And they answered, John the Baptist: but some say, Elias; and others, One of the prophets.
verses.web: They told him, “John the Baptizer, and others say Elijah, but others: one of the prophets.”
verses.ct: They replied, "Some say John the Baptist. Others say Elijah. And others say you're one of the prophets."

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am? And Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.
verses.web: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered, “You are the Christ.”
verses.ct: "But what about you?" he asked. "Who do you say I am?" Peter answered, "You are the Christ."

verses.kjv: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.
verses.web: He commanded them that they should tell no one about him.
verses.ct: Jesus strictly ordered them not to tell anyone about him.

verses.kjv: And he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders, and of the chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
verses.web: He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
verses.ct: Then he began teaching them that the Son of Man would have to suffer terribly, be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, be killed, and then rise again after 3 days.

verses.kjv: And he spake that saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.
verses.web: He spoke to them openly. Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.
verses.ct: He said all of this plainly, holding nothing back. Peter pulled him aside and began to scold him for saying such things.

verses.kjv: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples, he rebuked Peter, saying, Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but the things that be of men.
verses.web: But he, turning around, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and said, “Get behind me, Satan! For you have in mind not the things of God, but the things of men.”
verses.ct: But Jesus turned around, looked at his disciples, and rebuked Peter sharply: "Get behind me, Satan! You're not thinking about things the way God does — you're thinking like a human being."

verses.kjv: And when he had called the people unto him with his disciples also, he said unto them, Whosoever will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.web: He called the multitude to himself with his disciples, and said to them, “Whoever wants to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.ct: Then he called the crowd over along with his disciples and said, "If anyone wants to follow me, they must deny themselves, pick up their cross, and follow me.

verses.kjv: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel’s, the same shall save it.
verses.web: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; and whoever will lose his life for my sake and the sake of the Good News will save it.
verses.ct: Because whoever tries to hold on to their life will lose it, but whoever gives up their life for my sake and for the sake of the gospel will save it.

verses.kjv: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?
verses.web: For what does it profit a man, to gain the whole world, and forfeit his life?
verses.ct: What good is it if someone gains the whole world but loses their own soul?

verses.kjv: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?
verses.web: For what will a man give in exchange for his life?
verses.ct: What could anyone possibly give in exchange for their soul?

verses.kjv: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.
verses.web: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man also will be ashamed of him, when he comes in his Father’s glory, with the holy angels.”
verses.ct: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this unfaithful and sinful generation, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his Father's glory with the holy angels."
